infotexts.entitydescription.deconshower: Decontaminates the user and automatically shuts off when the user is fully decontaminated. Requires Deconsol to decontaminate.
infotexts.entitydescription.hazmatsuit1: - Mandatory equipment when handling fuel rods.\n- Requires an oxygen tank.\n- Does not protect from pressure.
infotexts.entitydescription.hazmatsuit2: A modified hazmat suit.\nIt has been adjusted to protect against water pressure up to a depth of 10000m at the cost of some of its radiation shielding.
infotexts.entitydescription.fuelrodtongs: Required to move active fuel rods around without burning your hands in the process. Can be stored in a toolbelt.
infotexts.entitydescription.geigercounter: Allows you to detect radiation. Can be used on characters.
infotexts.entitydescription.fuelrodcrate: Safely stores up to 8 fuel rods and prevents them from irradiating the surroundings.
infotexts.entitydescription.fuelrodcrateshelf: Can hold up to 2 fuel rod crates.
infotexts.entitydescription.potassiumiodidetablets: Light protection from radiation, useful as a precaution of an imminent low radiation hazard. Reduces low amounts of contamination.
infotexts.entitydescription.activatedcarbontablets: Used to cure low amounts of poisoning and radiation. Useless against contamination. Excessive use can be harmful.
infotexts.entitydescription.radioactivematcrate: Can safely store up to 9 stacks of radioactive ores or minerals.
infotexts.entitydescription.radioactivematcontaine: Can safely store up to 6 stacks of radioactive minerals.
infotexts.entitydescription.deconsoltank: A decontamination solution. Needs to be sprayed onto a contaminated person by using a sprayer.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.radiationresistanc: You are more resistant to radiation, however you are not immune to it!
The patient has built up a decent resistance towards radiation.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.contaminated: The patient is slowly irradiating the area. It's better to treat this sooner rather than later.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.contaminated.high: The patient is severely contaminated and a massive health hazard to others. Caution while treating is advised!
infotexts.afflictioncauseofdeathself.contaminated: You have died of radiation sickness.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.overheating.self: You're sweating. The surrouning air is way too hot. Better not stay here for too long!
infotexts.afflictiondescription.overheating: The patient is sweating a lot! They should probably vacate the area and cool off for a bit.
